item.title: 人工智能数据中心让电费飙升
item.description:
在数据中心附近地区，批发电价比五年前高 267%。这些成本都转嫁给了客户。【原文：

Wholesale electricity costs as much as 267% more than it did five years ago in areas near data centers. That’s being passed on to customers.

】

item.title: Verizon 正在洽谈购买 EchoStar 无线频谱
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Verizon 通信公司正在与 EchoStar 公司讨论购买其部分无线频谱的事宜。【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. is in discussions with EchoStar Corp. about purchasing some of its wireless spectrum, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 强大的鸭子》男主角在离职前几天给了亚当斯一百万美元
item.description: 支持纽约市长埃里克-亚当斯（Eric Adams）的超级政治行动委员会（Super-PAC）获得了布洛克-皮尔斯（Brock Pierce —）的巨额捐款。【原文：A super-PAC backing New York Mayor Eric Adams got a hefty donation from Brock Pierce — a child-actor-turned-Bitcoin-investor — five days before the embattled politician ended his campaign.】

item.title: S&P称有望将电子艺界降至垃圾级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司表示，预计在这家视频游戏制造商的收购交易完成后，将把Electronic Arts Inc.的信用等级降至垃圾级，理由是该交易预计将增加约200亿美元的债务。【原文：S&P Global Ratings said it expects to cut Electronic Arts Inc.’s credit grades to junk status after the video-game maker’s buyout deal is closed, citing the expected addition of about $20 billion of debt from the transaction.】

item.title: 谷歌将支付 2450 万美元以结束特朗普就 1 月 6 日禁令提起的诉讼
item.description: 根据一份法庭文件，谷歌同意支付 2450 万美元，以解决唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关于在 2021 年 1 月 6 日美国国会大厦骚乱后被禁止访问其 YouTube 频道属于非法审查的指控。【原文：Google agreed to pay $24.5 million to resolve Donald Trump’s claims that being banished from his YouTube channel after the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the US Capitol was illegal censorship, according to a court filing.】

item.title: 机器人顾问公司 Wealthfront 提交首次公开募股申请，显示利润下降
item.description: 在众多金融科技公司寻求期待已久的上市之际，机器人顾问公司 Wealthfront Corp.【原文：Wealthfront Corp., a robo-advisory firm, filed publicly for an IPO amid a slew of fintech companies pursuing long-awaited listings.】

item.title: Verdane 为最新的欧洲增长基金融资 20 亿欧元
item.description: 欧洲中低端市场投资公司 Verdane 为其最新的成长基金筹集了 20 亿欧元（23 亿美元），达到了最初的筹资目标。【原文：Verdane, a lower mid-market European investment firm, has raised €2 billion ($2.3 billion) for its latest growth fund, meeting its initial fundraising target.】

item.title: 赛勒对 "战略 "公司股价溢价的缩小不以为意
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）并没有让他的数字资产财务公司 Strategy Inc.【原文：Michael Saylor isn’t letting the diminishing premium his digital-asset treasury firm Strategy Inc. has long enjoyed over its Bitcoin holding distract him.】

item.title: 为什么美联储基金利率可能与市场脱节？
item.description: 美联储今年 9 月首次下调关键利率后，政策制定者们开始权衡降低美国借贷成本的利弊，一个新的问题开始变得紧迫起来：央行是否首先瞄准了正确的基准利率。【原文：As policymakers weigh the merits of lower US borrowing costs after the Federal Reserve cut its key interest rate in September for the first time this year, a new question is starting to gain urgency — whether the central bank is targeting the right benchmark rate in the first place.】

item.title: 盖蒂阻止债权人抵制与合并相关的债券交易
item.description: 图片供应商盖蒂图片控股公司（Getty Images Holdings Inc.这一过程包括争取投资者参与债券交易，为现有债务再融资。【原文：Stock photo supplier Getty Images Holdings Inc. is getting its ducks in a row to finance its acquisition of Shutterstock Inc. Part of the process includes cornering investors to participate in a bond exchange that would refinance its existing debt.】

item.title: 特朗普称内塔尼亚胡同意加沙和平计划，谢克尔跳水
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普称本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理同意结束加沙战争的 20 点计划后，以色列货币对美元汇率升至三年多来的最强水平。【原文：Israel’s currency rose to its strongest level versus the dollar in more than three years after US President Donald Trump said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agreed to a 20-point plan to end the war in Gaza.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会的阿特金斯将与 CFTC 的加密货币合作视为 "当前的头号工作
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）周一表示，协调加密货币规则是华尔街主要监管机构的首要任务。【原文：Coordinating cryptocurrency rules is the top task for key Wall Street regulators, US Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Paul Atkins said Monday.】

item.title: Optus 紧急呼叫失误增加，新加坡电信压力增大
item.description: 随着 Optus 又一次因紧急电话中断而陷入困境，危机已经蔓延到澳大利亚境外。这家澳大利亚第二大电话公司声誉受损的程度不断升级，其母公司新加坡电信有限公司（Singapore Telecommunications Ltd.）也受到了影响。【原文：As Optus reels from another emergency call outage, the crisis has bled beyond Australia’s borders. The escalating reputational damage to the nation’s second-largest phone company is now bearing down on its parent Singapore Telecommunications Ltd.】

item.title: 预测市场交易增长，Robinhood 股价攀升 12
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc. 首席执行官弗拉基米尔-特涅夫（Vladimir Tenev）表示，该在线股票经纪公司已强势进军预测市场，人们在预测市场上就选举、体育比赛和其他广受关注的事件下注，之后该公司股价上涨超过 12%。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. shares rose over 12% after Chief Executive Officer Vladimir Tenev said the online-stock brokerage has made strong inroads into prediction markets, where people wager on elections, sporting matches and other widely followed events.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称法国债务威胁经济发展
item.description: 法国央行行长表示，法国必须克服政治僵局，以解决债务负担可能使经济窒息的问题。【原文：France must overcome its political impasse to tackle a debt burden that risks suffocating the economy, the head of the country’s central bank said.】

item.title: Stripe 与 OpenAI 合作，允许使用 ChatGPT 购物
item.description: 支付处理公司 Stripe 公司表示，它正在与 OpenAI 合作，让美国消费者可以直接通过流行的人工智能聊天机器人 ChatGPT 购买产品。【原文：The payment-processing company Stripe Inc. said it is working with OpenAI to allow US consumers to buy products directly through ChatGPT, the popular artificial-intelligence chatbot.】

item.title: 加拿大最大养老金公司首席执行官抨击 "赢家通吃 "市场
item.description: 加拿大养老金计划投资委员会（Canada Pension Plan Investment Board）首席执行官约翰-格雷厄姆（John Graham）表示，加拿大养老金计划投资委员会对美国股市的飙升保持警惕，因为美国股市过于集中于少数几家大型科技公司。【原文：Canada Pension Plan Investment Board is wary of the surge in the US stock market, which is too heavily concentrated in a handful of big technology firms, according to chief executive officer, John Graham.】

item.title: 沙特计划打造视频游戏中心，与 EA 达成 550 亿美元交易
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯正在加速实施将电子艺界公司（Electronic Arts Inc.【原文：Saudi Arabia is accelerating plans to transform itself into a hub for gamers with its blockbuster deal to take Electronic Arts Inc. private.】

item.title: 詹妮弗-加纳的婴儿食品公司申请在美国上市，销售额不断增长
item.description: 由女演员詹妮弗-加纳（Jennifer Garner）共同创办的有机婴儿食品公司 Once Upon a Farm PBC 已在美国提交首次公开募股申请，加入了一批正在推进公开上市的公司行列。【原文：Once Upon a Farm PBC, the organic baby food company co-founded by actress Jennifer Garner, has filed for an initial public offering in the US, joining a list of firms moving ahead with a public listing.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司首席执行官发出信号：若欧盟禁令生效，俄罗斯液化天然气将重新定向
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）首席执行官表示，如果欧盟禁止进口液化天然气，同时又不制裁生产液化天然气的一个关键设施，那么俄罗斯的液化天然气运输可能会转向世界其他地区。【原文：Russian liquefied natural gas shipments could be redirected to other parts of the world if the European Union bans the imports while refraining from sanctioning one of the key facilities where it is produced, the chief executive of TotalEnergies SE said.】

item.title: 惠誉称：私人信贷可能在下一次危机中扩大冲击
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）认为，在下一次危机中，私人信贷可能成为一个 "重要的 "传导渠道，扩大对金融体系的系统性冲击，给广大投资者带来负面影响。【原文：Private credit could be a “meaningful” transmission channel during the next crisis, amplifying a systemic shock to the financial system with negative repercussions for a broad range of investors, according to Fitch Ratings.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会叫停因加密货币财政计划而上涨 959% 的公司交易
item.description: 在 QMMM Holdings Ltd. 的股价在不到三周的时间里暴涨近 1000% 之后，美国证券交易委员会暂停了该公司的交易，称这家数字媒体广告公司的股票可能受到了社交媒体上兜售者的操纵。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission suspended trading in QMMM Holdings Ltd. after its shares surged almost 1,000% in less than three weeks, saying the digital media advertising firm’s stock may have been manipulated by touts on social media.】

item.title: 美国银行预计 10 月份小额债券供应将反弹
item.description: 市政债券市场最大的承销商预计，在本月国家和地方政府借款放缓之后，10 月份该资产类别的债务销售将有所增加。【原文：The municipal-bond market’s biggest underwriter expects an increase in debt sales in October after the asset class saw state and local government borrowing slow this month.】

item.title: 美联储穆萨莱姆称决策者必须谨慎对待降息
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆表示，他对进一步降息持开放态度，但决策者应谨慎行事，因为通胀率仍高于央行的目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said he’s open to further interest rate cuts but policymakers should move carefully, with inflation still running above the central bank’s target.】

item.title: 美国打击被制裁企业的子公司，招致中国反击
item.description: 特朗普政府正在大幅扩大美国的制裁范围，将黑名单上公司的子公司也包括在内；这一打击行动迅速招致了中国的斥责，因为中国的主要科技巨头已经受到了美国严格的贸易限制。【原文：The Trump administration is dramatically expanding US sanctions to capture subsidiaries of blacklisted companies — a crackdown that drew a swift rebuke from China, where key tech giants are already subject to stringent American trade curbs.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会就对冲基金3.5亿美元倒闭起诉布莱恩-卡恩
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会起诉了 Franchise Group Inc.【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission sued Brian Kahn, the former head of Franchise Group Inc., over the collapse of a hedge fund that he helped run.】

item.title: 摩根大通 200 亿美元的 EA 支票标志着对私人信贷的胜利
item.description: 以 550 亿美元私有化电子艺界公司（Electronic Arts Inc.其中包括摩根大通公司提供的 200 亿美元融资，这是单家银行为此类交易做出的最大债务承诺。【原文：The $55 billion take-private of Electronic Arts Inc. has already launched a number of superlatives, including being heralded as the biggest leveraged buyout of all time. Part of that list, is JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s $20 billion of financing — the largest debt commitment ever by a single bank for such a deal.】

item.title: 人类学家称新模型可连续 30 小时独立编码
item.description: Anthropic公司正在发布一种新的人工智能模型，这种模型的编码时间比以前的版本更长、更有效，这是该公司在为软件开发者提供工具方面领先于OpenAI等竞争对手的最新尝试。该公司周一表示，这款名为 "克劳德-十四行诗 4.5"（Claude Sonnet 4.5）的新模型更善于听从指令，可以连续独立编码长达 30 个小时。相比之下，前一款名为 Claude Opus 4 的型号据说可以执行长达 7 小时的编码任务。【原文：Anthropic is releasing a new artificial intelligence model that is designed to code longer and more effectively than prior versions, its latest attempt to stay ahead of rivals like OpenAI in offering tools for software developers. The new model, called Claude Sonnet 4.5, is better at following instructions and can code on its own for up to 30 hours straight, the company said on Monday. By comparison, a previous model called Claude Opus 4 is said to be able to field coding tasks for up to seven h】

item.title: 道明集团承诺削减数十亿成本，重新推出指导原则
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）正在恢复增长指导，其目标与美国洗钱丑闻之前的目标相似，该银行承诺削减数十亿美元的年度成本，并通过吸引更多客户和向他们销售更多产品来增加收入。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank is reinstating guidance on growth — with similar targets to those in place before a US money-laundering scandal — as it pledges to slash billions in annual costs and boost revenue through a push to attract more clients and sell them additional products.】

item.title: 墨西哥 120 亿美元援助 Pemex 的协议有望刺激更多 P-Caps 公司上市
item.description: 墨西哥石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos）是世界上负债最多的石油巨头，该公司曾使用一种不起眼的融资工具来削减债务，如今这种工具正成为其他陷入困境的借款人的学习榜样。【原文：An obscure financing tool used to chip away at the obligations of the world’s most indebted oil major, Petroleos Mexicanos, is now emerging as a model for other struggling borrowers.】
